title: Rudolf Steiner: Educating Body, Soul, and Spirit
description: A 60-second lesson on Rudolf Steiner: Educating Body, Soul, and Spirit.

hook.text: A German cigarette factory asked a philosopher to design a school for workers' children. Rudolf Steiner created the

buildup.text: Waldorf education delays academics: no reading instruction before age 7. Instead, children learn through art, movement

discovery.text: The method follows child development: imagination before intellect, doing before knowing, rhythm before rules.

twist.text: Waldorf students start reading later but catch up by third grade and often outperform peers on creativity and

climax.text: Steiner showed that slowing down early education can speed up later learning. Patience is a teaching strategy.

punchline.text: The school that teaches reading last often produces the most passionate readers.

quiz.question: What is distinctive about the Waldorf approach to early education?
options: Delaying academics in favor of art, movement, and stories
